etymology.description: 止 (“foot”) + reversed 止 — one foot in front of the other.
etymology.interpretation: Two feet are shown, one flipped to suggest alternating movement. This imagery conveys walking and, by extension, a step or pace.

examples.chinese: 他向前迈出一步(他向前邁出一步)。
examples.pinyin: Tā xiàng qián màichū yí bù.

examples.chinese: 请放慢脚步(請放慢腳步)。
项目分为三个阶段，每一步都很重要(項目分為三個階段，每一步都很重要)。
examples.pinyin: Xiàngmù fēn wéi sān gè jiēduàn, měi yí bù dōu hěn zhòngyào.
examples.english: The project is divided into three stages, and each step is important.
